intro: Amellus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaf amellus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to ecological biodiversity.
